review_body: Highly recommend Moxy Tokyo, just make sure you know a bit the unique concept when you book but I personally love it: really cool and beautifully designed atmosphere, excellent value for money with all the facilities needed (gym, library, games, ironing room, bicycle rental..) but the best is really the people - very welcoming and friendly staff. Will surely be back, thanks for a great stay!

Had the pleasure of staying one night in this fun themed hotel. The room are not big but adequate and cool designed. The reception is also the Café and the bar where a DJ play music in the evening. The food is convenient but good.I will surely come back!

The hotel is very clean and hip and there's a direct bus from Haneda airport. The rooms are very large by Japanese standards. The location is also very close to a train station with plenty of dining options. I would stay here again!

From the check in at the bar to the DJs and bands in reception at night, the cleverly efficient furniture and the little touches - Moxy was definitely a good choice. The “crew” were super friendly and helpful and spoke great English. The rooms are small - as would be expected for Tokyo - and the breakfast options were appropriately balanced between local and international. The location is convenient to the train station and there are a ton of stores and restaurants nearby.

I was looking for a nice hotel for a night's stay in central Tokyo and was happy to find Moxy. It is a part of the Mariott chain but very chic, retro and functional.The staff was friendly and the checking was efficient in a 'bar like' front office. Checking comes with a welcome drink too. The rooms are compact with a comfortable bed. Just what you need for a good night's sleep

I will be honest that when i arrived i was sceptic about the hotel.Check in at the bar is not usual. But when we discovered the room we where  agreeably surprised. Clean,good size all you need for a stay in Tokyo. 5 min to the stationBreakfast presented in trendy format but all you need and the warm dishes where also offered warm,what is a problem in many hotels.Good price quality

The hotel is very close to the train station. The 7-11 is just across the hotel. They offer free bottle of waters and free lockers. Highly recommend this place, the decoration in the room is very trendy and cute. Really enjoy staying in this hotel.

We just came back from a trip in Thailand & Vietnam. We needed a place to stay for 3 days. And Moxy is just perfect for young couples. The staff is great, the rooms are not too small. There is a nice a gym... For me it’s a 5 star !

I stayed for 5nights(12-17/1/2020)​, it was really good time.When I checked in, staffs were so friendly, Also really good location, 5min away fromKinshicho Station,​ See​ you​ again​ soon​:)​#​Wandee​ room​ 407

This is typical Moxy with efficient space and millennial oriented amenities. And with that is staff with no proper manners.There’s incident where a staff accidentally hit me with the elevator door. While it’s quite hard but not dangerous. The staff only quickly ask if I was alright. Without apologizing, he quickly turn back and giggling with another Japanese guest, in Japanese. Left me in quite awkward situation in the rest of the elevator trip. He didn’t show any caring nor remorse about what just happened.They did, however, apologize to me later only after I report the incident to Marriott, where I find it’s pointless. Lack of manner isn’t what I would expect from Moxy, especially in Japanese standard.

This is a very trendy, party atmosphere hotel in a very good location. There is always coffee and tea available in the lobby. The lobby also offers great lounging space, games, fireplace, a bar, a cafe and a photo op wall dedicated to IG users. As usual, the female reception staff are friendly if you are male. Initially, we had one room booked for 4 people but once we saw the size of the room, we immediately booked a second room. The beds are like an XL Twin which can make sleeping challenging for a couple. The is no space or closer for luggage so we placed ours on the window ledge. There are a stools and a table that hang on the wall but there's not enough space to place them anywhere. The bathroom is very nice, the best part of the room actually...very spacious. A four-night stay was $1,073. This is a nice, clean hotel near the train and bus stations and plenty of eating locations. I would recommend.

Having stayed at and loved the Moxy in Osaka 18 months ago, I thought I would try Moxy Tokyo. The room is tiny. There is literally no space to leave a suitcase on the floor (and be able to access the bed).The furniture hanging on the wall is useless because there isn’t any floor space to put it. 2 squares metres would make an enormous difference to the rooms. The bathroom is better sized but not a traditional Japanese bathroom as one reviewer has suggested.

We stayed at the hotel for three nights. The staff was really friendly, and the rooms were small but comfortable. The bathroom was good too.The downside of this hotel is the location. After a very long flight and train ride, we were looking forward to a good night of sleep. Unfortunately, the hotel is located in a red light district, and there was a lot of noise during the night. This was quote innoying, and die to the pack of sleep we felt pretty tired during the day. So despite the friendly staff and nice rooms, I would not recommend this hotel.

The Moxy Tokyo Kinshicho Hotel is a really trendy hotel and the staff were very pleasant. It’s less than a 10-minute walk to the train station, and while it’s in what appears to be a red light district no one bothered me and I felt safe the whole time (as I did throughout Japan). The bathroom and shower are quite spacious compared to other hotels I’ve stayed at, there are plenty of pegs to hang clothes and the bed was very comfortable (I’m 6’ tall). The room doesn’t have a lot of space but it’s a new hotel and the breakfast in the morning was very good. There is a working area in the lobby, a small pool table and they appear to have quite a few DJ events in the evenings, so if your looking for a cool Western type hotel this is a good spot to pick.

I really enjoyed this hotel. Friendly atmosphere, especially around the bar. Central bar so can sit all around it. Easy going cheerful breakfast and very pleasant staff. The hotel doesn’t go big on facilities so don’t look for a pool or a gym. There’s a small games area. It’s in a nice area and about 5 minutes walk from Kinshicho underground. Plenty of restaurants in the area. All the ones we visited were very good. We specifically liked the local curry places.

I unexpectedly had to spend the night in Tokyo after missing a connecting flight due to weather. The room was just what I needed for one night, but I think it might be too small and in too remote of a location for a longer Tokyo vacation.Moxy rooms are intended to be very small and this hotel is no different. I had to no place to open my large hard suitcase in the room, except in front of the door. It would be difficult to manage more than one person and more than one suitcase in this room.The bathroom is great. It’s a traditional Japanese bathroom, so a little larger than you normally find in a Moxy.The night I arrived was just before a Rugby World Cup game in Tokyo, so the lobby bar/common area was packed with people. It was quite lively and fun. The staff were also great. They booked a cab for me to take me to the airport at 4am and it showed up promptly!The neighborhood is interesting but I found it totally safe. There is a 7-11 right across from the hotel so easy access to an ATM and other sundries. I’ve never stayed in this neighborhood in my past trips to Tokyo, it’s a bit far from from the more popular areas like Shinjuku, Shibuya, etc. it’s about a 25 min ride to Haneda with no traffic at 4:30am.

The room was clean and comfortable. I choose this hotel because it was close to the HPE office and subway station. But after I walked-in the room, I regret it. The room was very small with no closet space to keep clothes. There was no enough room to put a table or chair to work on. The bed is only full size which is very small for any big and tall people to sleep on. Maybe this is a Japanese standard? The area is very creepy and maybe “red light” area. Please be aware..... it was noise late nights till dawn because of the bar and nightclub activities in the area. I was unable to sleep because I could hear noises from the street at night. Too expensive to pay for this size of a room.

Room is very small, no place for luggage case.Breakfast choice is limited.Too expensive, as it for the facilities.5 minutes walk from Kinshicho station.Chain motel standard but luxury hotel price.2 miles distance from Sky Tree tower.Hotel is located in a seedy district.Anyway, I don't recommend this motel.

This hotel is spunky and different. A fun place. The manager Meiko is what separates it. Her recommendations for sushi, ramen and bars where absolutely perfect! Be aware that the hotel is not located in a big bar district though and is a long subway ride (or $50 Uber) from the more touristy areas of Tokyo.

Stayed here in October. While not the most central hotel for visiting Tokyo, most sights were very accessible from Kinshicho station. The station is serviced by both JR and Tokyo metro, with direct service to sights like Shibuya, Shinjuku and Skytree. And yes it is true that you are in a red-light district, but I felt safer here than most any other large city in the world.Originally staying 5 nights, we had to extend the stay for an extra 2 nights due to Typhoon Hagibis. It was a very surreal night when the Typhoon came in. But I have to say I was really impressed and quite humbled by how well the staff took care of us. You can image a hotel full of guests descending down to the lobby for drinks and food and while they were busy, they managed with supreme sincerity and had fun. FYI - the showers was one of the best hotel showers I've every seen.

Most of the guests were under 40 but it is just a more "Casual Friday" Marriott. It was bright and the staff are multi-lingual. It is very close to the Sumo Stadium and the Edo-Tokyo Museum (Also Good For The Young At Heart)

We stayed for 6 nights in October 2019. The hotel is quirky, informal and has great staff.We received a warm welcome and complimentary drink on arrival. The bar area has a good atmosphere and is open 24 hours. Good guest laundry facilities.Small breakfast buffet was ample.Easy walking distance from Kinshicho station.The room was very clean and had good facilities. Modern furnishings and good bathroom with shower. We would stay again.

Very nice and cool place with excellent, warm and friendly service. Rooms are small but well designed. Stayed here because I couldn’t get back to the US after the cancellation of my original flight. I will certainly come back. The whole staff is good but the one woman, who appears to be in charge (discretely and professionally) is superb.

review_body: I've stayed at a lot of Marriott hotels yet my first thought when I walked in is "This is a Marriott?" The Moxy is a younger hipper version of a Marriott. Young friendly people checking us in, neon signs, cozy barn themed rooms and an affordable breakfast in the morning. I would definitely stay here again!

It’s my first choice when staying in Tokyo. Clean, warm service, great location. I’m trying to email the hotel. I’ve been trying to call but can’t get an answer. It may be because of the typhoon. Can someone give me the name/email of the general manager? Or a way to email or what’s app the hotel, since phone number hasn’t been working?

I loved my stay at the Moxy Tokyo. First impression is incredible. You feel so relaxed and comfortable when you walk in and instead of a cold stone reception desk, you actually check in with the friendly and enthusiastic bar tenders. Yep, you check in at the bar. How cool is that? You’ll find yourself surrounded by comfy couches, a crackling fireplace, ping pong tables, board games, etc. This place is like a ritzy college dorm! Perfect for solo travelers, but I saw guests of all types too. The room was very comfortable. I loved the hallway and room design that felt like you were in an artist loft condo. The breakfast was tasty with multi-cultural cuisines. The location is incredible. It’s a quick walk to two different subway stations with quick connections to anywhere in Tokyo. I really liked that you could walk one direction and find nearby bars & restaurants or walk the opposite and you’re in a quiet, residential neighborhood. I’m now a huge fan of Moxy hotels and highly recommend the Tokyo Moxy.

The whole hotel is on another level! Funky bar area, super nice and comfortable rooms and situated in a lively area that caters for everyone's needs! Their breakfast was a delight (just wished I had a bigger plate so it does not look like I am greedy when going for seconds and 3rds lol. I will definitely book with them again, check in was at 15:00 we were there early due to short distance from previous hotel to them but rooms were ready and the friendly staff checked us in.

review_body: This hotel is in a good location,just outside of the center of Tokyo. It is close to Kinshicho station from which it's just a few stops to a lot of attractions within Tokyo.The hotel itself has a nice relaxing atmosphere. The rooms were nice and clean. Although a bit small, they weren't as small as we'd feared. We found the bathroom area of the room to be surprisingly luxurious. Breakfast was a nice mix of Japanese and Western style foods. Complementary coffee and tea was available throughout the day for hotel guests.The area around the hotel can be a bit noisy however. It didn't bother me personally since I'm a pretty heavy sleeper, however my wife did wake up a time or two.Overall we've enjoyed staying at Moxy Tokyo Kinshicho very much as we used it as our home base from which to explore Tokyo.

Ground level ambient is kind of fun, all activities circling around the bar-registration desk; yes, the bar is the registration desk when you check in-out. So you can use your time for calming your thirst at the same time you check in.No wallet; there is a complimentary drink that the hotel provides.In addition in our case, not sure if it was a temporary promotion, we were also given a tee-shirt with the hotel logo.Having said taht, the room was small where the "wardrobe" was a number of wall hangers and the "working desk" also hung up foldable table and chair.To be true, albeit small, the room was not so small as in other japanese style hotels we have been and we could easily go by.Additional comments: the hotel is located at walking distance from the Kinshicho train station and you can access Kinshicho for free from Tokyo Station using the JR pass if you have it. It's three or four stops so you can do it in less than 15 minutes. Other: there is a highway running right behind the hotel and the sound of cars passing may bother those with light sleep; other sounds that can be bothersome are the day and night crows cawing.The hotel is located in a lively zone with a good number of night clubs.

I have stayed in the Moxy NYC and love the design and decor. The Tokyo location is nearly identical. It is conveniently located about a 5-7 minute walk from Kinshichō train station so easy access to the Narita express. And there are plenty of restaurants within walking distance. The hotel has decent breakfast buffet with a mix of American and Japanese dishes. The bar is lively and the staff is friendly and extremely helpful. After my initial stay I traveled for several days in northern Japan. When I returned to Tokyo and got back to the Moxy it felt like coming home.

LOCATIONThe hotel is located only few steps away from Kinshicho station. HOTEL & ROOMThe design is very cool. It somehow combines some traditional local elements with the coolness and freshness of the Moxy brand. My room was quite spacious (compared to other hotels in Tokyo). It is nicely designed and features everything one would need for a holiday trip.STAFFWhen it comes to the staff, I had very different experiences. If you book directly via Marriott/Moxy, there is the possibility to chat via the Marriot Bonvoy app. At the moxy chat, before Check in, I could chat with the hotel staff to inform them about special wishes etc. The person behind the chat was super attentative and made everything we needed possible. (I.e. special request of high floor, away from elevators, two rooms next to each other). Staff at Check in and Check out was extremely friendly and super helpful. They did everything with enthusiasm and you could feel that they love to make their guests feeling welcome. On the other hand, we made an experience at the bar where they were not really friendly and welcoming. They made us rather feel unwelcome being at 1AM at the bar (despite the fact that they offer a 24/7 bar). So in General, i can absolutely recommend this hotel. It exceeded my expectations in some aspects. And the value for Price is absolutely ok.

I had a week stay at the Moxy. The lobby area is very fun and stylish. The front desk staff were very helpful and pleasant. Although the decor is lovely in the lobby and the surrounding areas, the rooms are fairly small. We stayed in the two twin bed room. The space between the wall and the bed was probably about three inches. It was two of us in the room and it was not the best setup. Even though the room has two beds, it's really only comfortable for one person. The hotel is in a good location, depending on what your plans are. We were able to walk to a few places, but had to use a taxi for most attractions. Everything was always a 20-30 minute taxi ride. A lot of the of our plans were in the Shibuya Station area. If you believe that's where the majority of your travels will take you, you may want to find something closer to that area. If my room were bigger, I would've enjoyed my stay much more. The guest service I received made up for the lack of space in the room. They were very accommodating. Space and location would be the only reason I wouldn't stay at this hotel a second time. If you plan on staying, from pics, it looks like the room with one bed has a bit more space. If you don't mind the limited space and the distance from certain areas, by all means book this hotel. You won't regret it. At least you know the room size. I wish I paid more attention to that, at least I would've been prepared.

Great stay at the Moxy Tokyo Kinschicho! It's our first time staying at a Moxy Hotel and loved it. Where else can you get a latte at the same desk that you check in at and have the same person do it?! Very open, welcoming space that inspires community. Almost like Starbucks as a hotel. Spotlessly clean, modern and hip, great food and a great staff of management and employees. The rooms are a little on the smaller side here but what they lack in size, they make up in creativity and modern design. We will definitely stay at a Moxy Hotel again and especially loved this one.

You are immediately welcomed with a big kiss from the giant set of lips on the double door and a huge pink bear before you follow the sign to check-in. Here you are warmly greeted by some-one who looks like a bar manager. Wait a minute! She is a bar manager, because she’s just served you a house specialty cocktail made from local spirits as she asks for your name and checks you in. Simply brilliant!After knocking back your welcome cocktail in your room, you may wish to head down to the well equipped basement gym set in ample space to run off the vodka. In the gym you’ll be greeted by funky flamingos and an assortment of Japanese pop culture figures. This is the same level where the conference rooms are as well.Laundry and ironing facilities are available and easily identified by some very interesting signage and murals. A library, games rooms, eating area and bar are all there too, but be sure to take your mobile or tablet with you as live posts through social media are not only encouraged but almost demanded by the staff. Load up your selfie, type #atthemoxy and check the global website for your post.The MOXY Tokyo Kinshicho certainly has more than you’d expect when you first walk through those sliding doors – it’s the kiss of life!Minimalism comes to mind but The Moxy rooms are exactly what they are… rooms. They serve their purpose with more than comfortable bedding due to the fact that their beds are the real deal. Parent brand the Marriott’s foam mattresses are of supreme quality, high-density soy-based comfort foam that you’ll find in all of their properties worldwide.Dining tables and chairs are waiting for you in every room, but the difference being they are just hanging on the walls ready to be used. But the big question is: why would you sit in your room when you could be out exploring this amazing city or mingling with the other patrons?The MOXY continental breakfast, starting from a very reasonable $16 AUD, is great value.Moxy Bar & Lounge is the social hub of the hotel, while the Lobby Bar & Lounge is part bar, part lounge and part office space. Join colleagues in the communal seating area for a working lunch, meet with clients or simply relax and enjoy light fare and cocktails. Open for breakfast, lunch and dinner.Noodle Station and the Deli allows you to “pimp” your noodles 24/7 with a broad selection of noodles and a condiment station to create your own flavours. Grab-and-go food and drinks are available around the clock for early risers and all-night party goers. Open for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Dress code is casual.Located in Kinshicho means that in terms of atmosphere, it’s more relaxed and – in some places – has a rough-around-the-edges vibe. Kinshicho, together with neighbouring Kameido – one stop east on the Chuo-Sobo line – forms one of Tokyo’s seven official sub-metropolitan centres, or fukutoshin.The area surrounding Kinshicho station is divided into a largely shopping-oriented north and a largely gambling and “love-hotel-oriented” south. North and south are divided by Keiyo-doro Street onto which the south side of the station faces.

Stayed with a friend for 2 nights, the lobby is spacious, bright and colorful. The room was more spacious (better use of space, bigger TV) than the Moxy Paris + the hardware quality was top-notch.The people working there are super friendly - great fit for the brand.The location (in a red light district) didn't bother me as it's within walking distance to a metro station.The brand is cool and surely appeals to the millennials.

It took us a while to find this place but once we did we had a blast! Loved the Lawsons across the street and the little ramen stand around the corner. Was there to celebrate my 50th birthday, staff here very friendly. Can't wait to go back!

This hotel is a lively reflection of the Moxy brand, you check-in at the bar which is also where they serve breakfast. The vibe is modern, refreshing and youthful. I stayed here because the hotels in the business district were too expensive and it was more cost effective to stay here and pay for an uber to/from the office. The rooms are in keeping with the Moxy brand and very modern, the bed was comfortable and the shower good. The TV is very limited for English channels but that is common across Tokyo (in my experience). The 4-star rating is largely due to the lack of furniture in the room, there is a tiny table and a folding chair which hang on the wall, this made it difficult for me to do any work in the evenings. If the business district hotels are too expensive then I would stay here again.

I really wasn't expecting very much from this hotel, since I was not very familiar with the Kinshicho district, but after seven nights, I love this hotel. It's nothing like the small, cramped, business hotels in Tokyo with only a Queen-size bed, wall-mounted TV, a small table counter, and packaged bathroom. The stylish room was larger with a king-size bed and larger bathroom with walk-in shower, roomier counter/sink and popular Japanese toilet. The front desk staff and the room service staff were all so friendly and polite, as well as professional and efficient. The amenities including wi-fi, TV, air conditioning, etc. were great. I booked a room for 5 nignts, spent one night outside of Tokyo, and returned to the Moxy for an additional 2 nights. For my trip outside of Tokyo, I stored my suitcase in a locker provided by the hotel at no cost and took what I needed for that one day in my backpack. The basement has a small fitness room and laundry room for guests, which I made good use of both during my stay. The hotel is just a ten-minute walk to the Kinshicho JR train station and Metro subway station, which is just fantastic to get you anywhere in Tokyo at a low cost and fast pace. For travelers who understand the Tokyo rail system, and first timers who will become experts, the Kinshicho location is just amazing and a hidden gem that is a well-kept secret. What didn't I like about the Moxy Hotel? It didn't have a small refrigerator in the room, which does make a difference when you want a cold drink after a hot day around Tokyo. But, that isn't enough to rate this hotel lower than 5 stars. A convenience store is just across the street from the hotel and department stores and coffee shops are just a block or two away. For families with children, they should consider that the hotel is in the entertainment district and there are a few bars and short time hotels nearby. As in all of Japan, safety is not an issue. This hotel is better than the other business hotels in Tokyo that I have stayed in, and at the same affordable price. For now, this hotel is my first choice to stay in Tokyo.

Rooms and bads bigger than in other hotels of this range in Tokyo. Lovely staff. I stayed here for 7 nights. The location is excellent only 5 min walk from Kinshicho station. Modern decor, clean room and friendly staff is a plus.One minus is breakfast - is a bit boring if you stay for a few days.But generally, we loved it.Is maybe not the best place to stay with the children, as there are many night clubs around.

My family and I stayed for four nights at The Moxy Tokyo. The staff were wonderful. The hotel is situated in a very interesting area and very close to a train station. Make sure to order some pizza from Uber Eats it's cheap and delicious.

Located close to Kinshicho station, although in a slightly questionable area (although still quite safe) we found the Moxy Tokyo to be unbelievably clean. Staff were friendly and accommodating, rooms are small but well laid out and comfortable. The hotel has quite a young vibe but we noticed a broad demographic of guest. We are staying here again on our trip and no concerns at all about having a positive experience

As a Proffesional hotelier in England I was very excited to experience the latest brand Moxy having researched the concept in university. I was not let down. This brand of hotel is designed for the modern millennial with a chic and unique style everything down to the messages wrote in the lift were great to see and really appealed to me.The person who wrote the review prior saying not a Marriott and not designed for business travellers I would say. If you wanted a business centre and someone to help you with everything you should have stayed at Marriott Tokyo, if you wanted something more modern and trendy this is the right choice. Yes there are bars and red light districts but you will only notice them if you go looking. I didn’t hear any noice or music in my room relating to the local facilities.Breakfast was good and had several American and English selection. I thought the staff were very engaging and were great at assisting with every request and really showed true hospitality. The hotel is away from central Tokyo but right next to a main train and metro terminal meaning you can access all of Tokyo from only a five minute walk from the hotel. If you don’t intend travelling and exploring then this hotel may seem away from city centre but for me the location was perfect. Rooms were clean and well maintained with no defects, air con worked perfectly and bottle water was available in the room and open bar area. I have since been to Moxy Osaka and I can say Moxy Tokyo is much much better in every way. Well done and highly recommended!

Let me preface my comments by saying that I’m typically not a fan of Moxy hotels. This hotel however was pretty decent and not crazy funky. Location was good and close to the train station (I’m not sure why others thought it was far unless they were coming out of the wrong exit). Laundry in the basement was fantastic and the gym even has a nice body measurement device (ie body measurements that others typically charge an arm and leg to do). Service was pretty good. Breakfast was a bit underwhelming but its a small hotel.

The hotel is stylish, hip and the room has no carpet so less allergy for me. However, location is terrible, in the red district of Kinshicho. Surrounded by girls bars that can be loud or rowdy at night. Untrained and unprofessional front office staffs, not trained to provide services for business traveller. They should not use Marriott brand for this since it is far from Marriott hospitality that i know. Very disappointing. Yes, it is a hotel with limited service, so does Ibis and holiday inn services. There is a minimum requirements expected of a hotel with international brand. This hotel failed to deliver on that. Not recommended at all. Such an embarrassment to call this Moxy hotel by Marriott.

Stay here for two nights, the rooms where comfortable. The hotel it self had finger/bar food which was good. As well as a full service bar. The staff were friendly and the location was good for taking trains.

We picked this hotel due to its location and good room rates. A decent funky hotel which reminds me of the Ovolo Hotel brand.All hotel related services are centered in the open lounge where the bar is the check-in counter. The staff who checks you in is also the bartender who pulls you a draft beer. So don’t demand free room upgrade annoyingly or your beer will be served warm! :-)Room is minimalistic and there’s no mini-fridge. Room size is big, especially by Tokyo standard.Location is good in terms of proxmity to the train station (5 min walk). Although the area is sort of a red-light district, we felt safe walking in the area late at night.Marriott titanium members don’t get free breakfast, but there are many dining options nearby.An overall a very pleasant stay especially for the young at hearts (aka, old people who like to pretend to be young)!

Stayed here as part of a tour. Bed was really comfortable, room very clean and modern. Breakfast was the most 'western' we'd had on our trip for those that want the comforts of home (think yoghurt, fresh fruit, pastries, bacon etc). Hotel is located in a great location and within walking distance to the station and many local sites. It is in a "love hotel" area although this did not present any issues at all. Japan is such a safe place. Lots of amazing restaurants close by. Would definitely reccomend

It was my first time at the Moxy brand. The room is small but as expected similar across all Tokyo hotel standards. Hotel public area is stylish, instagrammable. Room is equipped with a comfortable bed and necessary basic amenities. For what you pay for there will be trade offs such as tea and coffee availability while free is only for the taking downstairs at the cafe bar behind the bar. As for a week full on business trip I find it challenging to utilise the shared ironing board, located one on each floor. It is inconvenience when you have to iron several shirts for the week while other guests may need to use as well. I am all for sharing this facility since most of us use it once awhile but perhaps the hotel should offer individual one as well for those prefer ironing in his or her own room. The time I need to use each morning were usually having to wait for other guests to fining their ironing first but just little inconvenient to wait.The most disappointing gripe that I have however is the location. I'm all for slow walking 10mins from the nearest train station Kinshicho but that 10mins of getting hassles for girls, bars, drinks and more girls along the walk to the hotel is off putting and distasteful. No matter which routes you take, walking from Kinshicho requires you to walk pass men and ladies standing around on streets asking you - think bangkok's seedy area with upper crust respectful Japanese manners (some Japanese and some foreign nationals from South Asia asking you along the way). Unfortunately my verdict is to avoid this hotel in the future for this reason alone and not through the hotel faults except the planning for the hotel ought to consider this aspect. I am told by local friends the area is known for such seedy activities for a long time so I guess Moxy perhaps hoping it will get rejuvenated soon.There are many hotels around the area and as feedback I have read they do provide services charging hourly 1 or 2 stars class. Best wish to Moxy Tokyo. Great funky hotel otherwise.

I loved my stay at the Moxy. It was less than a 5 minute walk from the main train station that connects you to all of the big neighborhoods (Akihabara, Shinjuku, Shibuya, etc). The staff was very friendly and always had a smile and was able to assist us in English. We spoke very limited Japanese but they were kind to translate things for us and help us with Katakana on making reservations online.The hotel room itself was great - very modern and spacious for Tokyo. The bed was comfortable, shower and toilet were great! I also used the gym and washed my clothes in the laundry room downstairs for very cheap (like 300yen to wash your clothes and 300 yen to dry it a few cycles). Gym was great and not crowded. Hotel had a lot of lively guests as well and everyone was friendly.The neighborhood also had plenty of convenience stores and restaurants nearby. 7/11 and Ministop next door, family mart down the street, and so many restaurants in the alley / tall buildings by the train station. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Positive’s--Everything at this hotel is super cool!-Good sized rooms, especially for Tokyo-Excellent water pressure - plentiful hot water (plus nice rain shower heads)-Fast WiFi -I loved the slight industrial / Gotham appearance of the hallways and rooms-Very lively lobby / bar / game / seating area - lots of energy (and people playing board games)-DJ plays music in lobby most of the time-Very friendly and helpful staff-Convenience store across the street-Coin laundry available-Heated toilet seats-Close to the new Tokyo Tree Tower (2nd tallest structure in the world)-Nice wide TV screens! -Loved the “furniture on the wall” thing and hardwood floors-Well run hotel!Negative’s--The Moxy is a bit out of the typical tourist area. However, it’s on a main JP Rail line only a few stops from Tokyo (Central) Station-Not in the greatest of neighborhoods - a little R rated. However, never felt unsafe and no one on the street was ever pushy-The breakfast scrambled eggs were really runny - had to ask for them to be cooked more. Ditto the bacon. Not a Positive or Negative--Check-in is at the bar in the lobby

Marriott is known for great hotels and I've stayed at the Moxy in the US with pleasure. This Moxy is off the mark. It is about a half mile from the train which seemed great but the neighborhood is filled with hotels that sell by the hour or by the night. Girls, Girls, Girls signs are the atmosphere. As to the hotel, rooms are tiny, no dresser, closet or place to put a suitcase open. For $350 night it's highly overpriced. Only one person at the front desk spoke English and had to be beckoned for any needs. The 7-11 across the street is at least a reasonable place to get snacks and beverages.

I did quite a bit of research on Moxy because I have never stayed at one before and its location before booking and everything met my expectations. Location: a short 5 to 7 minutes straightforward walk from Kinshicho train station. The bus station is just next to the train station. Totally manageable with luggage. If you must take a taxi, it will cost about $5. If coming in from Haneda, I'd recommend taking the Keikyu Limo Bus (coach) to the hotel because it's direct and very convenient. Taking the train would require changing trains which could be cumbersome with luggage and figuring out which platform to board trains. The bus is 920Yens vs. 670Yens for train. The convenience is well worth the extra 250Yen (~$2).The area itself is near many "gentlemen" clubs. It did not bother us and we did not encounter any problem. In fact, we felt safe walking late at night because there were always people and "bouncers" around. There are many restaurants along the walk from the station to the hotel. There is a gyoza restaurant a block from the hotel and the store front has a red awning. Hotel staff told me that it's a great restaurant. I think it's called Komeida Gyoza. I searched it on TA and indeed it has great reviews. Unfortunately, I didn't get a chance to try it. Definitely will try it next time. There is a 7-11 and Mini-mart across from the hotel. There are 3 dept stores w/ food departments very near the train station. Check-in: no problem at all. I used mobile check-in and indicated early arrival (1pm). Room was ready. Ms. Meiko Ishii checked us in and she was very professional and helpful. She helped me changed a couple of restaurant reservations which I appreciated very much. The rest of the staff was also helpful. As a Platinum member, I get $10 F&B credit per day per person + a welcome drink. Breakfast was not included but I used the F&B credit and paid a nominal difference of ~$1.5/each. BTW, they have great cookies, too for $2.25/each. Breakfast offers a good selection of food (western and Japanese). The pastry is very good. One night we had fish and chips and swirl sausage for dinner. Both were good; better than I expected.Room: Our room has two twin beds. Decent size for Tokyo standard. There is no safe or drawers. But there are plenty of wall hooks for hanging your clothes. Chairs, coffee table and luggage rack are all folded and hung on the wall. Bed and bedding are comfy. Bathroom is good size and functional. The shower is the best! Lastly, room was clean for us. Internet was fast and reliable.We were very happy with our stay and will stay here again. Thank you Ms. Meiko Ishii and staff for a great experience.

Location about 8minutes from the metro station or bus from Haneda, I expected a better environment around. Lots of women clubs opening in the evening with a lot of noise around 3:00 when all these people have finished their « work »!Lobby when I checked in full of people with private party at the same time gave us a confusing moment to understand how to manage... ? Mix of bar and check in not pleasant.Rooms are OK with comfortable beds.Computer was down when I checked out of the hotel... I am really not fan of this hotel

A modern, trendy and stylish hotel. About 5 mins walk from Kinshicho Station. Staff was friendly and welcoming especially Ms. Meiko Ishii who is super helpful and professional. Room was clean, bed is comfy and the bathroom is big enough. Everything you need is here. Good breakfast too...will definitely come back..

The value for the money here is great, being a titanium member, I received free breakfast, welcome drink and $10 f&b credit and had a nice view of Tokyo tower. The hotel is modern, fun and family loved it with the various games, rooms are laid out nicely. Breakfast was great and overall price of drinks is very good when compared to other hotels. Staff was great and gave recommendations to local ramen noodle shop. Stored our bags in their free lockers as we buzzed around Japan on train. A 8 min walk to the train station, will definitely stay here again (well I am in a few days).

Chill hotel with good vibes. Bar is open 24/7. Minimalist rooms, clean and functional. Location is cool, bunch of “clubs” right around the hotel. No laundry or room service (if that’s important to you). Overall a good experience. Kind of like a stripped version of a W hotel.

I stayed here while in Tokyo on a business trip and was so happy with everything about this cute boutique hotel. The location was very close to the train station and it was also conveniently located near a huge grocery store. Free delicious coffee in the morning was a nice perk. The room was so practical with everything you needed in a hip and cool way. I would definitely book this hotel again if ever in Tokyo again.

Stayed here recently and must say it was solid with a few exceptions. First the staff is extremely helpful and friendly. Big plus. Great marriott status recognition, easy subway location, fun vibe, stellar design, reasonable pricing and a solid breakfast. We enjoyed our stay here and are big fans with only one draw back that would have made it a 5 star experience. THE SMOKING! The smoking area is right in-front of the entrance so all the cigarette smell just lingers and fills the common areas (including the breakfast area in the morning) and consumes the elevators with a suffocating nicotine smell. I’m honestly really surprised a well run property like this that the first impression is a deep seeded smell of cigarettes. I think they do try to mask it with a scented spray but you cant hide that disgusting stench!***Advice to mgmt, move that smoking station far away from the entrance! If you do that then people can expect a 5 star stay. ***

Moxy offers sharp compact design and cool ambience - IF- you are not looking for Tokyo center or Ginza. It’s just off Kinsho station (direct train from NRT) - just print out a map or use GPS.The downside is you must master complex rail transit to easily get around. Or use slow and expensive taxis (street system is a maze). At night, Moxy’s neighborhood becomes “adult entertainment” Overall -Good value, Marriott quality with rock n roll edge, but avoid street facing rooms (noisy) and buy a train pass or Penguin transit card

Great hotel with comfortable bed and amazing water pressure in the shower. The rooms don't have closets but have a few hangers if you need to hang your clothes. It has a very minimalist decor to it. The location is a few minutes walk to the train and subway station, with an airport bus stop that takes you to/from Haneda Airport directly. Not the mention the staff are super friendly. Plus, if you want to stay in, they have games in their lobby that you can use (Foosball table, Jenga, old school video games, etc). It is also located across 2 different convenience stores (Mini Mart and 7-11). Although the hotel isn't in the heart of Tokyo, the subway or train makes it convenient to get around. Lastly, the bathroom has a lot of amenities (dental kit, shaving kit, etc.) but they don't offer body lotion or any soap bars. Instead, they have liquid body wash in the shower.

Moxy tokyo is just opened for a short period of time. We tried this property because of the Marriott membership status. The hotel is located in Kinshicho area - you can take both JR and metro to go there. This area is full of shopping malls and restaurant and is easily accessible to all kinds of spots in Tokyo, especially tokyo skytree!The hotel has a sharp appearance and decor. There are lots of public working area too and no restaurant is with the hotel, instead, there is a small area selling food like a tuck shop. Reception agent is also a bartender doing all the things for guests. For Marriott elite member we get welcome drink coupon, and we also get $10 F&B credit as amenity. It is actually quite generous as food and beverage there is not expensive.The room looks smart and cool, although it is not spacious. They hang all the furniture on the wall to release more area, what a smart idea! The room is cool and we really like it. The one downside is that my room is facing the highway so it is so noisy during the night time. As we have a back to back stay in the hotel, when we check out we request a room not facing the highway and they give us another room type. We really appreciate that! We use the F&B credit to redeem the cocktail and food, which are super nice too!!! There is no bathtub but the shower head is strong. No brands on the amenities. The hotel also provide rental on bike so you can do cycling around the city. Overall a very nice stay with Moxy as a budget hotel.

review_body: Not your typical “old style” hotel as others have mentioned. Definitely marketed towards the younger generation (think of Cosmopolitan hotel in Las Vegas). Great spot for us. We enjoyed our stay.Typical smaller style rooms common in Tokyo but very stylish and functional. Just a couple of blocks south of Kinshicho metro station makes it easy to hop on subway. Yes it is located in neighborhood of “gentleman clubs” but fairly discreet and did not affect our stay. Check in at the “lounge bar” is pretty neat with welcome drink.Nice relaxing lounge as well as adjacent quiet library area for reading/working on computer, etc.Basic workout gym with two treadmills, two elliptical machines and minimal weights.Buffett breakfast was not too bad. ($1300yen)(ours was included with booking rate)Serves both western(croissants, eggs, bacon, cereal, yogurt, fruits)and Asia style (miso soup, rice, steamed salmon or mackerel as well as hot vegetables).Room and beds were comfortable with small bathroom but great shower.We loved our stay and would definitely stay here again.

Moxy is an interesting cooperation between Marriott and IKEA. You can tell staying here is going to be a very cool experience the minute you step into this hotel. The reception area is essentially a bar. The public area has a fun and stylish decor. And the receptionists are young and energetic. Everything is telling you this is not going to be just another typical Japanese hotel.The guest room is not big but by no means tiny if compared to Tokyo's average size. And the space is smartly used. All the furniture that you might not need every day is hung on the wall, which makes the room more spacious.The only criticism I have about the hotel is the neighborhood. There are many nightclubs in the area. When the night comes, expect to see men in suits trying to get you into one of the clubs. I have to say it is slightly annoying having to deal with their constant approaching, but I did not feel at any point that I was harassed or in danger. Another smaller problem that I think the hotel can fix is the floor material in the shower, which does not seem to absorb water quickly. I took a shower before I went to bed, and the next morning when I stepped into the shower again, the floor was still wet.I would recommend the hotel to travelers who are looking for a cool, young and vibrant choice of accommodation. After staying here, Marriott and IKEA both become so much cooler in my eyes.

booked a reservation through marriot with my spg gold number and it has been pretty much a nightmare ever since and I have not even arrived at the hotel yet. I clearly told the agent I was looking for a room for my husband and I (we discussed a bed big enough for two) he quoted a price and I booked. I'd had a reservation with a great rate through hotels.com but cancelled it after booking directly with the hotel. as I always do, I checked to make sure the reservation was correct the next morning (today) and it was for one person not two. in Asia, they charge more for two people so I was was concerned and called the Marriott reservation number to fix the problem. spoke to four people. the first didn't even understand the problem. the second read every word in the reservation outloud to me including the taxes, and every fee that will be charged, but didn't acknowledge my issue. the third put me through to a supervisor who put me on hold for 15 minutes then disconnected me. the fourth time I called, they connected me to a out of service number when I asked to speak to a supervisor. I called back a fifth time, asked to speak to a supervisor and the woman totally ignored me and decided she was going to help me herself. that's when I hung up, started to write this review and looked up the number to the corporate offices. how is it possible Marriott does not understand they are in the customer service business and that customer service begin the moment they first talk to the potential guest? ugh. horrible experience and I'm currently searching for another place to stay where they appreciate that money is hard to earn and that I have a choice where I spend mine.

This hotel is known for it's location, close to Kinshicho Train station - this is the main reason for selecting this hotel, and it's proximity to subway stations. While this is not a full-service type of hotels, it caters to the younger crowd - it is not the best place if you are looking for a family-oriented hotel, but rather very suitable for couples, or those who enjoy the night life. Although the rooms appear small, compared to North American standards, it is reasonable with respect to Asia or European hotels. There is entertainment, special events, etc. on a nightly basis which caters to the younger generation, it also works well for those with a limited budget especially in Tokyo. The location may be somewhat noisier than other areas of town but that is just to be expected given the proximity of the hotel. The rooms are extremely clean and the hotel amenities, public areas and hallways are well-kept. The check-in and check-out process was simple - a nice treat when the check-in staff offered free drink vouchers and small bag containing oral hygiene. The staff are very welcoming, and do make sure that our stay was pleasant throughout. If you are looking for a top class restaurant in this hotel, then you will be disappointed since this hotel does not cater to that, and also there are many good places to eat in the area so, why not? The food at this hotel is for those looking for a quick bite, and simple lunches/dinners. You cannot fault a hotel's catering - just because. We had a small hiccup during checkout due to system malfunction, but the issue was quickly escalated and resolved within a few hours. Appreciated Ms Drescher for tackling the problem quickly. Overall, this is a highly recommended hotel for it's attention to customer service and excellence.

Moxy Tokyo KinshichoNew Year in TokyoAfter having been spoiled for a week in Moxy Osaka, I was taken back by the small size guest room at this Moxy Tokyo hotel. I then found out that Moxy Tokyo was a conversion of an office building into a hotel which means the room layout was dependent on the existing floor area and window configuration. While the interior design and all the furniture were the same as Moxy Osaka, but the circulation around the beds was very tight. The sound isolation was poor as our sleep was disturbed by traffic noise and boisterous street revelers at night for the first few nights.On the plus side, the front desk staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms are super clean and serviced daily. Hotel facilities included free gym, 24 hours café, large screen TV and free Wifi. There was no tea making but there was a water boiler in bathroom.The hotel is conveniently located within 5 minutes walk to Kinshicho station which is a major transport hub where you can catch trains, buses and even limousine buses to Haneda Airport. Most of the tourist attractions can be easily reached by train or buses. Shopping malls and restaurant were aplenty within 5 minutes walk as well. There are half dozen ‘Girlie establishments’ nearby with friendly bouncers at door but they are only catered for Japanese clients. We were there for a week from 26th of Dec to 2nd of January. We were surprised that Japan was not into celebrations for New Year Eve. All shopping malls and restaurants closed early. But there was a huge cost penalty on hotel prices and the same for Christmas which was similarly quiet. I would suggest that we should move our holidays before Christmas or after New Year in the future.

Fun and modern hotel with good train proximity to a well-services station (especially nice to have rapid service directly to Tokyo station). Reasonably priced, very clean and comfortable rooms. Rooms are small, but perfectly adequate for 2 people, and in line with other hotels in Tokyo.

It was my third time staying at the Moxy! The hotel is located near Kinshicho station (6mins walk). Easy excess to public transportation : JR line, subway & airport bus limousine to/from Haneda airport. There are many restaurants choices and supermarket nearby. Loved the hotel concept, vibrant & lively atmosphere that makes me feel energetic! Comfy bed and cosy room. The room is bigger than expected for Tokyo standard. There’s no minibar but don’t worry there are 24 hours convenience stores opposite. The hotel itself has a cool lounge with funky bar where I love to chill out.Kudos to the hotel staffs they were friendly and helpful. Well done & keep it up! I’ll definitely come back next time.

We went in the winter and the heat makes the room super dry so please do ask for a humidifier. We stayed in a room facing 7-11 and it gets quite loud in the middle of the night when the red light district stores are closing. I am not a light sleeper so it didn't bother me much but if you are a light sleeper it might wake you up. The staff are really friendly and speaks very good English so there was no trouble communicating. The hotel is within walking distance to Kinshicho JR station (about 3mins walk) and it's also close to the Airport Limo service to Haneda Airport (the bus stop is right beside the Kinshicho JR Station). Across the street of the hotel there is a 7-11 and a mini mart. A 0101 department store is about 2mins walk away and in the basement there is a huge supermarket with everything (sushi, booze, snacks, fruits etc)

Depending on your preference for a hotel, this one really appeals to the young, cool and funky types, but the rooms are still comfortable and clean enough to sleep well into the night. Only about 5 to 7 minutes walk from the Kinshicho Station of the JR and subway lines, and 3 stations from Akihabara Station where the JR Yamanote Loop Line is, one station from the Ryogoku Station where the Edo-Tokyo Museum is. I did a walk to the Tokyo Skytree in about 25 minutes but actually only a subway station away so on the overall a rather good location. There is plenty of food choices too at the Kinshicho Station area though some might not like the bar and night life environment just beside the hotel.

This was my first time staying at a Moxy and it was exactly what I thought it would be like. The majority of my cooler photos were obviously taken for my insta story so none of them are here, but take my word for it there were a lot of them. The rooms themselves were not nearly as small as I had thought they would be and we're plenty of room for a solo traveler like myself. The #aesthetic is real and alive at this hotel and it's the perfect mix of space efficient and urban chic. For the price it's truly a great deal. The amenities are thoughtful and useful - the only thing that gave me pause was the lack of body lotion. I was also somewhat surprised by a lack of mini bar but that was again probably a space efficient thing. Other than that I had everything I could have wanted.

review_body: Overall nice hotelCheck in staff during check in and check out quibble with plat members about benefits which I’d already confirmed with platinum liaison What a needless way to give a sour opening and ending to the stayA real pity

Nice hotel in Urban Style - a mix of New York and contemporary New Nordic style. The concept goes the whole way, from soap in the shower, over the old school phones in the rooms and the “light signals” in the toilets. They even have a fussball table. Amazing concept with 24hr reception in the bar, there’s the centrepiece of the hotel. There’s also a nice Fitness-room in the basement.

The Moxy in Tokyo is a fabulous hotel whichever way you look at it: cost, location, facilities, atmosphere. Above all, they have a tremendous team: friendly, helpful, hard-working, cool, trendy, beautiful. If you are travelling to Tokyo and want a different, better hotel experience...stay at the Moxy!

Love this hotel, tiny rooms and all. Such friend,y staff, excellent breakfast, complete amenities in room. Just ride the JR in from Narita to Kinshicho station then a 10 minute walk along a smooth sidewalk and you're there. We arrived at 10:00 am and they had a room ready for us in a few minutes.

just back from a week at the Moxy.Great staff, new facility, very reasonably priced. Close to the train station. Area is OK- not typical tourist.We found the staff to be Very welcoming.Would stay again

Love the fun and funky design of the lobby and rooms. Great breakfast, fun nightlife. A bit farther from the heart of Tokyo, but nearby two train stations and easy to get to and from. Great staff, super helpful and good with English.

Nice change from usual hotel chains. Staff very helpful, fun, creative and professional. First time I have ever checked into a hotel at the bar. Clean room, good location near train station. Good breakfast selection. Highly recommend staying here.

I travel approximately 200 days out of the year due to work and must say I have never stayed at a hotel like the MOXY and never bothered to write a review about a stay(This alone should tell you something). Ended up booking this Hotel at the last minute through the Marriot app using rewards points for 2 days. After our booking at another hotel fell apart. Loved the MOXY so much, booked the rest of our stay at the for an additional 8 nights.The hotel staff are very pleasant and accommodating, not once did I feel like I was burdening them as they were always happy to assist. It creates a very welcoming and inviting feeling and sets the tone throughout your stay.The room is a very modern, but still has the retro feel of Tokyo. It's very well kept and clean, appreciate that fresh water bottles are provided every day. Plenty of entertainment is offered. The lobby maintains a very energetic feeling with music going. Afforable & fun entertainment is offered nightly.My girlfriend and I began every morning by grabbing a cup of coffee and playing Jenga before venturing out into Tokyo. I would squeeze in a quick game on the Nintendo as well. Only a 5 minute walk to Kinshicho train station.There is a library/lounge on the opposite side of the 1st FLR where you can read through interesting books. Also a table with convenient plugs for your electronics and laptops if you need to knock out a few e-mails or work. WiFi is extremely fast. Yes at night there are many people standing around outside the night clubs, but not once did my girlfriend or myself feel unsafe. Never bothered, threatened or harassed, people are very respectful of others in Japan.

After staying in Moxy, Osaka (which was faultless - and absolutely fabulous- highly recommend staying there), we had high expectation for the Moxy Tokyo! Our experience was highly disappointing - given the hotel location's (Red light district and night clubs) you can hear everything going on outside within your room (When asking to see if a higher room was available to try and block out the noise, we were simply told my management to drink more alcohol to send us to sleep!!) so my recommendation would be to only book this hotel if you have no where else to stay and as a very very very last resort!! The walk from the tube station is most unpleasant (A large amount of men and women are in the streets touting for your business for the large amount of 'women clubs' in the vicinity). Whilst we were not approached directly, it was a very worrying experience- which cant be avoided if you want to get to the hotel. This hotel shouldn't be part of the Marriott group so please don't be fooled by the misplacement of advertising. The hotel also plays extremely loud music in the lobby/ drinks area all the time (It was as though they were trying to make themselves 24/7 nightclub also!! )- regardless of what time it is so don't bank on a relaxing coffee/breakfast in the morning or to be able to talk to the person you're actually with.The location of this hotel is its greatest downfall and we did question whether what was happening outside the hotel, was being brought into the hotel. Whilst we didn't experience this directly, a large amount of men/women were always seen round the entrance of the hotel and at the cross roads just before the hotel.The only positive from our stay was that the room was clean.So... please book this hotel with caution!

We recently spent 4 terrific nights at this fantastic hotel. Maiko was so helpful-she assisted with directions to all the sights. Very cool vibe and even though we are seniors, we loved it! We previously stayed in the Munich Moxy and were excited to stay here as well. Loved the lobby, the breakfast, the friendliness of the staff, and our room with a view. We had a room with twin beds on an upper floor. The bathroom was great and had a nice sized shower. Room was modern and comfortable. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from the train station. Would recommend this hotel.

Meet all my expectations and beyond. Easy check-in and out. Excellent staff attention to my needs kudos to Anne who went the extra mile.Good breakfast buffet type ( they even have real Canadian maple sirop) . Bed and pillows was super comfy. Nice vibe in the lobby.Excellent location near Tokyo subway and JR station 5 minutes. I strongly recommend this hotel for your next stay in Tokyo.

We had a great two night stay at the Moxy. We are in our 50s/60s and my husband is a longtime Marriott Platinum member. The lobby was fun; check-in was easy after an 18 hour travel day from the US. Short, easy walk from the train station. Yes, the neighborhood is in the red light district, but it was not terribly obvious, nor did we ever feel unsafe. Our room at the Moxy was great, small, but clean and comfy beds and awesome well-lit bathroom. Not sure why some other Marriott brands (Renaissance, Ritz Carlton) don’t provide adequate lighting in bathrooms. Manager was delightful and who doesn’t like a free drink upon check-in? We chose the Moxy, because you couldn’t beat the price and we were pleasantly surprised. We are not their target age group, but the Moxy exceeded all of our expectations!

The positive side is the rate is decent, and short walking distance to the train station.Small room. I don't try breakfast after reading other reviews. Poor English staff, slow check-in. Staff emailed to remind to bring AAA card as room has AAA rate. But this hotel has low booking rate so it turns out regular rate is cheaper than AAA so I cancel then rebook member's lower rate thanks to their unnecessary email. Overall, it is not bad but I'd try another one if I come back to Tokyo

I spent the weekend at the Moxy Tokyo and it was a great stay. This was my first stay at the hotel and I was excited to try out the brand as I had never stayed in a Moxy before. The room design was good - different than a traditional hotel, but completely functional and had no issues whatsoever. Spacious room - bigger than expected for Tokyo. Good amenities in the bathroom (even a hairbrush). Check-in at the bar - which seems weird at first, but it's actually fairly practical and efficient. The location is 2 blocks from the metro station and there's a 2-stop rapid train into Tokyo station. On one day, I walked to the Senso-ji temple and it was about a 30 minute walk, but it was a good stroll through neighborhoods & a park, so if the weather is nice, it was a very pleasant walk (used Google Maps).Staff spoke good english, so that wasn't a problem as I don't speak Japanese (other then hello and thank you). Several restaurants nearby which were good and had picture menus to order off, which made it easier.Overall, I would stay there again as the price was more reasonable than downtown tokyo and it's an accessible location.

This hotel got me thinking about my reviews. I've never really considered the checkin process to hold much weight. They are almost always very good. However things were different here. To be fair as possible I have categorised my reasons. Note the score above is probably for youth wanting to stay in a hip and budget solution. Check-inWe arrived from a long trip from Hiroshima so were pretty exhausted. I'd booked this as it was owned by Marriott and with my status I usually get really good service along with the late checkout that I needed for this trip.The checking in was strange. It is done in the bar area and it doesn't really work. It did not help that I had the worst check in I have ever encountered. This was solely due to the hotel staff who checked me in. This was the first person who was of non Japanese descent to check us in and that famous Japanese hospitality was immediately lost. I mentioned that I spoke to the hotel staff yesterday to make a correction to my booking. He agreed this had been done (I mentioned the time and he was able to work out the staff member I spoke too). However he was not willing to accept the conversation happened on the phone the way I described it. I said fair enough lets ask the guy I spoke to. If there was a misunderstanding then Ill accept it. This is where things got weird. He said that would not be fair on the staff member. What??? He would rather offend a lifetime Marriott member then simply ask the staff his recollection of the conversation. Even worse he decided to inform me what the staff member was trying to say - and of course it was a very different interpretation to mine. He then lectured me on Japanese customs and told my mother when she asked about the vegetarian breakfast option that customers had expectations that were too high. His performance was abysmal and rude it was this that spurred me to make a formal complaint. Very un-Marriot like too. When I have issues before the hotel staff were the ones making it better. Here he made it worse.His boss was very good. She seemed gracious and understanding and wrote us a nice letter. RoomsSmall and very hip. There are no tables or chairs set up. They are folded on the wall and you have to set them up. Rooms are small so if you do it eats into the space. Great lighting and controls all easily accessible. Big issue for Japan though is no refrigerator. Bathroom Small but great shower. BreakfastNot good - skip it unless you like very badly made food.LocationIts in the red light district which took me by surprise. To my relief it was generally safe but it gets noisy and I would still take precautions. 5-8mins to major rail and subway lines and close to the SkyTree (15-20mins walk).StaffI have commented on the checkin staff person. However it is not fair on the other staff who were great. At night one helped me ring for a takeaway and at breakfast another help me track down a few tracks that I liked. The Director of Operations was pleasant, seemed to get it and helped in my mind partially make up for her checkin staff person. OverallOne for the younger generation I believe. The check in process was abysmal but I have scored it based on what I think the youth would want. Personally I would never stay here again.

We stood for 6 nights on the 4th floor (room 412). Room was smaller than advertised on Hotels.com. When we complained about this issue, Manager said that all the rooms are identical and is not there fault. Room was less then 18 sqm, not 24 sqm as advertised. We had the same breakfast for 6 days and only a few choices for western buffet. Sausages and bacon were cold and even if we complain to manager, on the next morning was the same issue. When it was crowded there were not enough space on the tables for breakfast.Room window was not able to diminish street noise. A few "love hotels" are near by and a lot of loud people on the street all night long. The staff speak only a little bit of English, but fortunately the Manager was British or American so we were able to discuss with her.
