review_body: The cozy boutique hotel, practically arranged with all useful details, spacious comparing to Tokyo average, is a jewel.As always, the hotel is clean and staff friendly.Breakfast offers not less, but not friendly and more, good for everyone.Location is good, but the distance to metro and JR station is slightly too far to carry heavy luggage..

In general I enjoyed the stay at the hotel. the decor is really cute, staff is friendly, rooms are clean and comfortable albeit small.However, i personally did not enjoy staying in that neighborhood. it is kind of like a relight district, it didn't feel dangerous but the area is not clean and when you go to fast food restaurants in the morning for a breakfast, the crowd were people who just finished their night shift at clubs or bars. there also aren't a lot of good restaurants around, the mall attached to the train station was boring too...in general, nice hotel, but i didn't like the area it was in.

Moxy stands for playful/fun/colourful, and if you are so used to the regular Marriott or Starwood hotels, Moxy is Aloft to the Starwood model, ‘sadly’ Moxy rooms do not have a safe or mini-fridge, we found the pillows were flat and too soft for our liking, queen bed a tad too small for us, ask the bar for your complimentary PJs, standing shower and room design had the industrial chic look which we really really love. We stayed in Room 503 (corner room) though being a Marriott member, should have given us the 10th floor, just saying but we got 2 lightly infused maybe vodka I think complimentary welcome drinks which we enjoyed.

Moxy is a modern hip place and since we consider ourself to have lived long but not being old and the rooms looked nice we decided to book with Moxy Tokyo Kinshicho.Yes, it's a bit noisy when checking in since you do it at the bar but it's all fine. The rooms are big, for Tokyo standards, and the bathroom is excellent for the size of the room and the showers are amazing. If we should ask for something then it would be some kind of storage in the room. Either more hangers or, perhaps, drawers under the bed (seen that in some other places that has limited space).. Can't say anything about the food options as we didn't try them.. the drinks in the bar are good and not to pricey for a hotel bar (saw a lot worse prices in other bars)The Hotel is located near the JR trainstation Kinshicho (which also has a subway line adjacent) and a few minutes more in the other direction is another subway line. So you can get to basically anywhere in Tokyo in about 30 minutes.One small downside was our rooms placement which was right across from apartments with balconies so we went with drawn blinders all week (didn't do much difference since it was raining most days). We did NOT try to get room with better view as we weren't in Tokyo to sit in the hotel room :)All in all - we can definitely stay there again if/when we go back to Tokyo.

The Moxy has a fun vibe, staff were friendly, and the room was excellent. Decor was updated, and more importantly so were the mattresses and bathroom. The rain showerhead was nice and the shower was spacious. There was plenty of sink space for both my friend and me. Breakfast was usually crowded, but they kept the food well stocked so there was always everything available. The only shortages I ever saw were briefly of coffee and hot water.

A very trendy hotel in a very interesting street. Not adviseable for single ladies travelling alone unless your brave enough. Room is of an appropriate size and lots of shops around the corner. Walking distance to the metro.

The room were clean and bigger than most room in tokyo. The hotel is near to a train station, restaurants, and has a convenience store right opposite to the hotel. But the hotel itself has a cool lounge with funky bar and the gym were great.

I stayed @atthemoxy for four nights and loved it. The place has a great vibe, the staff is excellent, the gym is very good by Japanese standards, and having laundry onsite is a huge bonus for me because I'm on a 50+ day trip throughout APAC.The bar/lobby area is always lively. They had a classical music duet the other night--magnificent! They also have two old school Nintendo Classic consoles, so I of course had to play some Super Mario Bros!The location is a good in that it is outside the madness of Shinjuku or Shibuya, yet everything is very easily accessible by two major train stations within a 5-6 minute walk.

As a person who likes this kind of vibe I enjoyed staying here. By Japan standards the room was quite big and the shower was amazing. Missed having a fridge in the room but you can get ice from the bar. Having reception at the bar can be a little difficult if they are understaffed but hey we’re are on holiday so didn’t mind waiting. The area around the hotel is fantastic for the subway and shops. It can be quite ‘colourful’ at night but that was no problem. Breakfast was okay but could do with another toaster oven to speed things up. Would definitely stay again.

Easily my favorite hotel, especially after living there nearly 3 months :) and here's why: the rooms are really spacious like for Japan standards, very clean with nice bathroom and shower, comfy bed and cool modern look - not your typical Marriott, your check in will be by the bar with cool music vibe in the background and welcome drink in your hand. Basement has laundry room and gym with great equipment - weights, elliptical, trainig bike etc. Basically everything you need is here.The staff is absolutely amazing, and I can't stress this enough. Everyone is nice and super helpful, special thanks to Anne for making my stay so nice!Neighborhood is filled with tons of great izakayas, not all of them have English menus - but just go up to 6th floor of Marui Shopping Mall, and all of them have one. Walk to the station - maybe 5 minutes. Area might looks bit sketchy at night for first time visitors, but that's just the look. It's actually very safe and lively. Very convenient location, highly recommend it and I'll definitely come back.

I tend to stay in this area because I used to live within a few minutes walk away which means i can hit up my local yakitori and izakaya's when I am back on business. It is also very convenient to either Narita or Haneda which is another upside of the area via train or using a bus to TCAT and honzomon line. So this time I chose the Moxy and as a Marriott Platinum it was nice to be able to stay in the network.The hotel was nice with a comfy bed and I like the style a lot. The hotel also had a gym which is pretty unusual in Japan. I didn't try breakfast as I just grabbed some stuff on the way to work from Vie De France by the station. Rooms were quiet and the lobby had a good vibe The only thing I wished it had was japanese style bathtub in the room and not just a shower. I don't have one where i live now and i missed the ofuro ritual when back in Japan

Millennials will LOVE this place! from the modern & easy check-in to the cool lobby/library to the room's industrial design down to #OldSchool rotary phone and of course the fast and stable Wifi. Oh, enjoy the bed and pillows, makes u feel being wrapped in clouds of comfort.

I visited Tokyo on a whim and had to chose a hotel accordingly. I lucked out by choosing The Moxy having never stayed at a Moxy before. I have to say, without a doubt, this was my luckiest decision related to my Tokyo visit. The hotel is extremely clean, neat, and the design and atmosphere left me speechless. The room designs are very ergonomic, modern and minimalist, which I love, and the hotel vibe is electrifying.They have a bar and lounge that is open 24/7 and a staff that could not have been more welcoming and warm. They made sure my visit felt like home and we even ended up sharing some drinks and laughs together once they were off the clock. The best part about it that, having charged all of my drinks and food on the room, when I checked out the cost of the stay was half of what other hotel rooms would have cost for one night, without food and drinks included.The hotel is conveniently located near the train station which has lines running to all the different Tokyo attractions at very reasonable costs.While there make sure you visit the charming Shimokitazawa neighborhood which boasts excellent original restaurants and shopping stores. I also would not miss the largest pedestrian crossing at Shibya as well as the Observatory at Tokyo Metropolitan Government Building where you can view the amazing Tokyo skyline.If I get the pleasure to visit Tokyo again I am definitely staying at the Moxy.

The location is walkable from Kinshicho station, ~3-4 mins. There are 2 convenient stores opposite the hotels, so don’t worry for food or snack, and noodle and bar are there for you at lobby. The room is Japan standard. I like the way they do hanging tables and chairs on the wall, so we could have space for bags and not feeling too pack. All amenities you needed in the room, iron room is on every floors.I also had a chance to have breakfast at the hotel, it’s small line but it’s enough for starting of the day, food is good quality. For someone who concerned about the neighborhood, I arrived at the hotel around midnight on Friday nights. I saw several drunk people (actually, the other places are the same either Shinjuku or Roppongi) but didn’t feel dangerous.

Stayed here for the last few days I was in Japan with my spouse. We enjoyed our stay and the staff played into that heavily. They were all very friendly and great to talk to when we were at the bar. It's worth noting that the drinked and food served were really good and priced well. From check in to check out we had no problems with the hotel. While the area can be a bit sketchy at night, during the day everything is perfectly fine.Starting with the rooms, small but really well organized. So it's a long hallway when you first walk in, but that's because the bathroom takes up a whole front corner. At the back of the room is your bed. Tucked into this small space perfectly. The window has a large sil that you can use as additional storage, especially when the curtain is pulled down. There's a folding chair and table handing on wall you can take down to use when you want to at something that's not your bed. there's a sort of brown leather lounger chair by one side of the bed. While it was pretty comfortable and we did use it a lot, it does make the space a but more cramped. Thinking about cleanliness, everything was spotless and stayed this way day to day. Seriously, very clean.I loved the bathroom. A great toilet, large vanity, space to move, and a wonderful shower. It has great pressure and both a rainshower head and shower wand. One thing is you'll need to step up into the shower. And I mean up... it's a bit off the ground, probably for the plumbing. It's not THAT big a leap, maybe like 6 inches.I got breakfast with my stay and it was pretty good. There wasn't a huge variety and it was the same day to day but all the food was fresh and filling. I loved the little cheeses. There's a small gym in the basement that I didn't get a chance to make use of but all the equipment was need and working as far as I could see. I did make use of the laundry room which was a saviour. Not super expensive but the dryer does take multiple runs usually. Just make sure to check the lint trap before starting, it makes a huge difference. While it does dispense its own soap, you'll likely want to add some of your own. Overall, we had a great stay at the Moxy. The staff were a big part of our enjoyment and I want to thank all of them for your help and kindness. If I'm back in town this is my first lookup for a place to stay. The price couldn't be beat for a similar experience. Plus, it was really close to the train station, it looks so much farther on the map but its pretty close.

Nice hotel. Small but very well organized room. Good facilities. Bar and reception is the same place. Excellent value. The night we were there they turned the lobby area into a live DJ hot spot with lots of well dressed people. It was pretty loud with bouncers etc. Strange but an experience nevertheless.

We have stayed at other Moxy in the US so we have some expectations and familiarity of this hotel chain as well.Being a platinum member the staff was quick to recognize and very efficient during the checkIn process. During the stay all of the staff members were very helpful, communicative, friendly and fun to talk to! As noted by others the location of the hotel is interesting part of Kinshicho but the advantages of proximity to restaurants, department stores, supermarkets and convenience stores are outstanding. Very close to metro and JR so can save you money on taxi to get to and from hotel. One of the managers, Chris is simply outstanding and we enjoyed knowing him. The room is a double beds- efficient, excellent shower head and the furnishings are typical of all Moxy hotels. No surprises for us and for those not familiar, give Moxy a try. JR train provide direct train service to the Kinshicho station from Narita ...but not the high speed dedicated NEX-type train. I don't missed this part as long as I don't have to switch trains so the Rapid JR train is fine with me. Less than 10 mins walk to the stations. Breakfast offering and service is excellent as well and music in the evenings is also fun for the younger crowds. Would definitely return to this hotel on next visit to Tokyo.

Stayed 4 nights Aug 16-20 2018I have not written a review for a while but I feel compelled to do so for the Moxy Kinshicho. To find such a good place in Tokyo that is extremely good value is rare. In Moxy Kinshicho I found it. From the moment you walk in, it is a friendly place. Anna and her staff are welcoming. There is music playing throughout which automatically gives you a great feeling. If you haven't stayed at a Moxy ( by Marriott ) before, it is a reduced service model, but that doesn't mean much because it is very friendly service. Reception doubles up as part of the bar and with a friendly greeting, a cold beer to welcome me, and off to the room. I was given a room on 8th floor. Rooms in Tokyo ( Japan ) are particularly small. This was no exception. But better than most I have stayed. The bathroom is ample, with nice water pressure, a nice big vanity unit and hot water! Great. I had a queen bed room, the bed was all new fresh linen, a good size and very easy to sleep in. ie; comfort +The air-conditioning is excellent. You control your own. And have it as cold or as warm as you like. Bloody fantastic. One of the features of Moxy branded hotels is no desks in the room. I understand why they do this, they want to encourage a community spirit in the common areas. But to be honest, this is a feature I am not enthralled about. I am as social as the next guy, but when I am working or just socialising online, sometimes I prefer to do it in my own space. So if there was one thing that would stop me from booking Moxy again, this would be it. ( But it's not a complaint, I know this is the model for Moxy and I booked this time knowing they have no desks in the rooms ). But for me, there are more reasons for staying, than not. Like the wi-fi. Very fast, tested at 40MbpsI never experienced the in-house restaurant or breakfast because you are in a great local neighborhood. 95% of the people you will see are local Japanese folks and I love it. There are literally hundreds of bars and restaurants within walking distance so your options are almost overwhelming. And it's within walking distance to Kinshicho Station where you can access transport, either JR or Keikyu Limousine Bus to HND or NRT. I did experience the bar. And it's very funky music. And the guys are very friendly. Make sure you have a beer with Jazz, a really interesting fella from New York who's living and working in Tokyo. And it's a 24 hour bar. So if you have travelled a long way to get here and suffering jetlag and feel like a beer at 4 in the morning because it still 8 pm where you have come from, you can. What's not to love about a 24 hour Bar. Summary: Has to be one of the best value hotels in Tokyo for my liking. Good local neighborhood, very friendly team and a-c that works for you! Hallelujah! And very fast wifi. And if you're a Marriott member, you'll pick up a few points along the way. This place is not for you if you like all the bells and whistles, the expensive flowers in reception and lots of white gloves, but if you want good value for money, you've found it. Would I recommend: In a heartbeat.Would I stay again: Yes. I am.

A very warm thank you to Anne Drescher and her team for your hospitality. It was a pleasure to spend our last night in Japan in your hotel. Nice, easy going and comfortable. Very friendly staff, excellent service. All the best to you. Kind regards, bg with family, Vienna.

Highly recommended this hotel. Extremely accommodating! The rooms were spacious. Anna and her staff were fantastic. They recommended places to eat and made our family vacation in Tokyo the best! Thanks so much!

review_body: Checked out of this hotel very recently. And It was completely disappointing. Complimentary water was technically available in the room. However, once you finish the water, it will not be topped up. There will be no more complimentary water after you consume 2 bottles which I found it quite stingy. If Location is a big deal for you, you should consider staying somewhere else. It takes a lot of times to get to Harajuku, Shibuya and Shinjuku. On top of that, this hotel is also not a family friendly hotel since it is sat in the middle of sketchy area. It kinds has like a brothel vibe.

We stayed in last February as family trip. It was first time to stay moxy brand but was great choice I have made.Staff was very friendly and helpful.Kudos to moxy team, I will definitely choose to stay again!!

If you're looking for a fun, modern, and quality place to stay in Tokyo, Moxy Kinshicho can't be beat! This place cares about your time spent with them and your visit in Tokyo. Ask them for suggestions on dining, attractions and spas because they know it all!Well done Moxy Tokyo, thanks for the hospitality. I'll be back!

I want to share a terrified experience in Moxy Tokyo which just happened last night (July 22, 2018) My family and I stayed in moxy Tokyo from July 21 to 22, two rooms on same floor. Around 2:26 am my mom called me:”someone just opened my room! Due to the locked chain across the door, he couldn’t able to walk in. Thus he kept pushing the door loudly and woked me up. I saw his hand reaching inside trying to unlock. I shouted “who is it!” No replied and he just ran away.”I called the front desk around 2:50 am. The staff said:” Sorry and thank you for telling me this information. I don’t know what happened but I will go to you floor to check.”This morning, we all pulled down our luggages to eat breakfast since knowing our rooms weren’t safe. I told the front desk what happened last night again and a staff said, “I was on duty whole night but I didn’t get any phone call.” Unbelievable, was I talking to ghost? I asked them to check the security camera to see who was trying to enter my mom’s room. The staff agreed and said that he would give me an explanation and wanted to give me free coffee as compensation. But I told him that “This is not a problem about free coffee, it’s about safety, the simplest thing a hotel should provide.”After breakfast, he told me that “It was our staff that tried to enter the room. Because you checked in before 12 pm yesterday, and our system showed your room was empty. Our staff need to check empty room. Sorry for the scaring. It is a big problem and we will have more staff training.”I said, “why didn’t he stay and explain to my mom? He just ran away! It was very scaring we would think it’s a thief! “ My mom asked, “Which staff? Tell me the name.” He said, “we need to confirm.” Obviously, he lied to us. If it was system error, then the staff would check my room as well, but no one tried to open my door last night at “2 A.M.”I am truly angry that Moxy’s front desk want me to believe that it was a system error and staff training problem. But I think it is much more serious if you don’t tell your customers the truth. That it could be the thief who wanted to break in my room and stole worthy inside.LIE TO YOUR CUSTOMERS and try to distract to other aspects is more serious than a thief gets in moxy hotel, which means, this incident will happen again and again. I’m writing this not because I want to get any compensation in this terrified experience. As a customer, a parent and a loyalty Marriott Platinum member, I need to know how the hotel managing safety problems and how to fix it if something went wrong during their customer stay. My friend told me Kotobashi, the Tokyo moxy located, isn’t a safe area. He won’t choose any hotels there. Well, how do I know Moxy Tokyo is located in an unsafe area? How do I know someone can get in and open the room so easily? Since I didn’t get a good explanation from Moxy, the only thing I can do is sharing the horrible experience public. Someone told me this could happen in either JW Marriott even in Ritz Carton as well. Thus, remember to bring your passport and money every anytime and locked the door chain every night. Keep safe!2018.7.21-22住東京錦糸町Moxy，遇到超恐怖事件與大家分享。半夜兩點半剛好兒子起床上廁所，看到5分鐘前有媽媽的未接來電。住同層樓的媽媽說：「有人開我房門，還好我有上扣，他就一直撞門，我被吵醒起來看，看他手都伸進來想要開門，我問是誰，人就跑掉了。」媽媽嚇得不敢睡，怕我也遇到一樣的事，趕快打電話提醒我，門要反鎖還要扣上。我當下打去櫃檯，櫃檯說抱歉，他會去那層樓巡視，不知道為何會有此事，謝謝你告訴我。今早我們想說小偷可以這麼輕易進房間，就把行李通通都拉到一樓吃早餐，以免行李被拉走。再度跟櫃檯說此事，一名看似是小主管的日本人說，他值班了整夜，沒有接到電話。（是鬼接的嗎！）我要求日本人查看監視器，他說好，也有說很抱歉，問我要不要喝咖啡作為補償。我說不用，我想知道發生什麼事情，這實在太恐怖了，身為會員，我必須要知道我以後還能不能再住你們飯店。他說他現在去了解原因。吃完早餐後，他說要跟我解釋這一起事件：「是人員疏失，因為你們中午前check in沒有進系統，因此系統顯示為空房間。工作人員晚上要逐一檢查空房間，很抱歉我們會加強人員訓練。」我說，有哪個工作人員會開門，發現有反扣還一直撞門，客人問是誰，也不留下來跟客人好好解釋，而是直接跑掉？我媽氣死了，問他是哪一個工作人員，他不說是誰，只說他要再確認。我完全不相信他說的。如果工作人員要檢查空房間，那為什麼沒有檢查我的？電梯需要房卡感應，進門也需要房卡，哪個工作人員會三更半夜檢查空房間，客人問是誰還跑掉！我猜他應該是心想，人員疏失問題總比飯店安全問題小，但我認為跟客戶說謊就是大問題，表示同樣問題會重複發生。由於獲得的理由超爛，飯店只打算請咖啡裝沒事，要趕飛機也沒辦法留下來看監視影像，我只好寫出來提醒大家。達人朋友告訴我錦糸町，新宿東口、池袋、板橋、龜戶都不安全，儘量不要住在這些地方。哩程社團的社友說，就算住五星級飯店也會發生這種事情。提醒大家不管住哪裡，房門必須扣上，必須反鎖（如果有），不要把錢財護照留在房間。

The Moxy offers standard comforts in a minimalist environment.Rooms are relatively small and spare, but staff are welcoming and there's a convivial bar/lounge scene.Good breakfasts with yoshoku {western style) options.A five minute walk from JR Kinshicho station: frequent direct trains from Narita. Connect at Shinagawa from Haneda.Close to a "girlie bar" neighbourhood, but, this being Japan, all is safe, secure and polite.Very good value.Recommended.

We came to Tokyo representing Hong Kong rugby league. We were welcomed warmly and treated like family..I can genuinely say that I have not experienced any better hospitality anywhere in the world.Anne and her staff shared our victory with celebration, doing all the little things that really made the difference.Many thanks to Anne and the staff of Roxy for the wonderful hospitality. I will certainly be staying at the Roxy on my next visit to Tokyo.Tim McCosker  Physiotherapist for the Hong Kong national rugby league team

We recently spent three weeks in Japan...traveling from Tokyo-->Kyoto-->Hiroshima-->Yokohama...and the Moxy by far was our favorite. Why? The staff! They were so welcoming, personable and kind to my family (we have three young girls). They even took the time to give my 4 year old daughter a thoughtful present on her birthday. It was perfect! The hotel itself is clean, new and modern. It is fun with a few common spaces and shared games (Jenga, Uno, Foosebal, video games etc) that my girls loved to play. The breakfast was very tasty and reasonably priced. I definitely would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a spot to crash in Tokyo. As mentioned, it is a 5-10 min walk to a train station which connects everywhere in Tokyo. We had no problem getting around from Kinschio Station. There are restaurants, grocery stores, mini-marts, and sights to see all around the hotel. It was wonderful hotel for us, and if/when we make it back to Japan, we will most definitely book another stay!Lastly, on Friday they have a Mexican Food truck that serves up very, very good Mexican food if you need a culinary break from the Japanese cuisine.Thanks #atthemoxy

We loved this hotel! From the moment we arrived the staff was wonderful and accommodating. We were a family of four ( 2 adults, 2 children) traveling from the US. The hotel was about a 7 min walk from the subway station. From reading the other reviews I was not sure about the neighborhood but it was fine, and my boys had no idea about some the the "local business" in the area. Lots of little restaurants and some shops. There is a family mart right across the street from the hotel. The room while compact did have enough space for three roller bags. The bathroom was actually quite spacious and had an amazing shower. The beds were larger than a US twin but smaller than a double. The breakfast everyday, while simple, was more than enough to fill us up. There were eggs, a vegetable, salad, pastries and rice, miso and some fish. There was also fruit and yogurt. There is coffee and tea service all day as well.The rooms and the hotel were all very clean. There is a laundry room on the basement level.I think the best part was the vibe of the hotel. It was very modern and fun. There were a few video games, Foosball, and some board games all there to play. We would definitely stay at a Moxy again while traveling.

When searching for a hotel Moxy was a Marriott brand I had never heard, now it is probably my favourite.This hotel is less than a 10 minute walk from the train station if you leave via the south exit. It’s a very connected location.The modern vibe in the hotel is a nice change with the reception/concierge/bar being the centre of the action. A welcome drink on arrival and free breakfast for Marriott rewards members is appreciated.The breakfast is a combination of European pastries, rice, soup, fish, eggs, bacon and a random ( from mash potato, carrots, corn & mushrooms, broccoli & cauliflower or stir fry veg) selection of vegetables.The rooms are small but functional, if you are in Tokyo you probably won’t be spending too much time in your room anyway. The drencher shower is excellent and you get 3 channels on the TV in English.The staff are super friendly, especially Christopher who helped sort out storing our bags.

Having never stayed at a Moxy before, I was so impressed with everything here. The place used to be a block of Goldman Sachs offices, but has been transformed into what looks like a brand new hip apartment block with a serviced first floor. There is a bar (where you check in) and café, with bar and café-style seating. They also rent bicycles which is great for getting around. Breakfast is at the bar area, and they serve regular breakfast items and ramen at a window. How cool is that? The price is also shockingly low for Tokyo, a real bargain.

We loved this hotel as it had a very nice room, included breakfast for Marriott Elite Members, decent work out room, and great location close to the train/metro station. ~5 minute walk to the train/metro station to get you around Tokyo and Japan if needed! Also, there was coin operated laundry in the basement if you need to do laundry. Each floor also had a iron and iron board area. We took a the metro directly from Narita airport to the hotel which took about an hour, but was easy and convenient. If you want to try this you take the JR Narita Line to Chiba Station, stay onboard the train it then gets listed as teh JO Sobu Line taking it to Kinshicho Station. Get off and walk to Moxy Hotel. Best thing to do is to have a map for Tokyo downloaded or have some type of data service for you to use Google Maps, it's worth the investment. With all hotels in Tokyo the rooms are tight, but the Moxy had a nice room that was comfortable for my wife and I. The bathroom by comparison to other hotels I've been in at Tokyo was spacious. One note there is no "closet" but there are wooden pegs on the wall for you to hang up some clothes. The breakfast was good every morning although not much variety. They have salads, bacon, eggs, potatoes, pancakes, etc... but grab a bowl of Ramen. Not the best Ramen in Japan, but will give you something hot in the morning if you like it. The only thing that we did not like was that there were some men/women around the area that "hung out". Appeared to be folks associated with the clubs in the area. Anyhow, they didn't bother us, but was a little "shady". Other than that, we very much enjoyed the hotel service, the rooms, the work out room in the basement, and the breakfast.

I stayed at the Moxy as a part of the touring Hong Kong Rugby League team in June 2018 and we all enjoyed or stay. The hotel has comfortable and friendly atmosphere and was very welcoming. The facilities and buffet breakfast are nice and the staff were very accommodating to us, even making us congratulatory posters and giving us a big welcome back after our teams victory. Big thanks to Ann and the team at Moxy!

Ohayo gozaimas... Greetings from the Land of the Morning Sun... in the heart ♥️ of bustling Tokyo... a city that never sleeps like NYC ... a stone throw from Kinshicho JR Train Line ... surrounded by different restaurants... I love Ramen ... The staff are awesome pretty cool ... The environment is hip hop ... good for the young and not so young as well ...

I stayed at the Moxy Tokyo for a week. I absolutely love this hotel. It was an approximate 6 minute walk from the train station. The room was very nice kept very clean! Close to plenty of eating places! Would definitely stay here again.

They were warm, friendly, professional and very accommodating to our needs! Ann was a great help and the Hotel definitely has a youthful yet appropriate atmosphere! We arrived and originally we thought our booking was for two bed but we arrived and realized we accidentally booked for a queen and the fixed our mistake no questions asked and no extra charge. The food is amazing with locally traditional cuisine with a hint of American traditional to ease us into the culture.- The Perez Family

We just got back from a 3 week tour of Japan and stayed at 6 different hotels, and by far we liked this hotel the best. We stayed here several days.The room was small, but everything was extremely well thought out, and the bathroom was nice sized. There was no closet, but there were many hooks on the wall so you could hang things. There was no floor space to put your luggage, but there was a big window ledge where we put our luggage and this was even better than the floor because it was easier to access our things. In the bathroom there was a long, narrow, glass shelf, where we put our makeup kits etc. The shower was a really nice size, the water pressure was great. We ate breakfast in our room a couple of times, and to do this we took a folding table off of one of the hooks in the room and set it in-between our two twin beds and we sat on our beds to eat. This might sound cramped, but it really wasn't. The room was bright and clean, and just felt good. The beds, sheets, and pillows were comfortable.About the location......this was our first stay in Japan and we were really jet-lagged so we didn't go out at night. We did notice, though, that there were a couple of go-go bars nearby, but they were fairly discreet and the neighborhood was very clean, and I'm under the impression that this wasn't an issue at all. There was a mall nearby with several restaurants in it. It is very close to the train station (about 2 blocks), so this was super convenient. When I was booking the hotel I was a little concerned about not being right in downtown Tokyo, but I think this concern was really unfounded because there are so many different neighborhoods in Tokyo that you'll want to visit, and you'll end up taking a train or subway to them anyway. The workers at the hotel were super friendly and nice, and always willing to be helpful.

Cool boutique hotel near everything with a laid back feel. We checked in for two nights and made our way through the town. There is a mall about 5minutes walking distance and in the same place is the metro. When using the metro we looked up all of the places we wanted to visit, wrote the names down and showed the teller at the station. The teller told us where to purchase the tickets which were apx 220 yen = around $2.00 USD per trip. There is also a small grocery market at the bottom floor of the mall with the freshest sushi, bread and everything in between. Prices were super cheap.

We stayed at the Moxy during the final leg of our honeymoon trip. We were excited to see the Moxy hotel style, and it sure did not disappoint. So cool, the details in the rooms and common areas are so well designed and fun. Crazy and quirky details make it a very hip hotel. The room was smaller, furniture hangs on hooks if needed to be used. Tight squeeze for 2 but it was fine for a quick trip. The neighborhood is a little nuts at night, it gets very loud. The red light district was a little crazy, but if you keep to yourself you're fine. Service at the hotel was ok, check in took forever and they make you pay for an early check in. But overall fun experience.
